question:
Write a letter to a friend who is looking for a part time job to support his studies. In your letter

- Describe the job you found for him/her

- Explain why this job is good for him/her

- Say what he/she needs to do to get the job
text: I hope this letter finds you in radiant health and the best of spirits. When we met last week, you mentioned that you are searching for a part-time job to finance your expenditure, and this is the reason I am writing to you today.

Yesterday, I met my old friend, Prachi who owns a beauty parlor in Gachibowli. Her business is flourishing right now as many colleges have opened in a nearby area and so she was searching for an assistant, especially in the peak evening hours. When I mentioned that you were looking for a part-time job, she seemed very eager to contact you and talk about employment possibilities.

I thought this job will be perfect for you as you are free in the evening, and you have done certificate course in beautician, and is well aware of waxing, threading, and facials. The job will be from 5 pm to 8 pm and you will be getting around 5000 rupees plus incentives based on your performance. Moreover, if you work on Sundays, you will get extra income accordingly.
I hope this opportunity piques your interest. You can contact Prachi if you are interested in the job. Her number is 945903582.

error_list.error_des: The spelling of parlor is a non-British variant. For consistency, consider replacing it with the British English spelling.
The noun phrase certificate course seems to be missing a determiner before it. Consider adding an article.
